item.title: Live Updates: Hong Kong Towers Smolder From Fire That Has Killed at Least 44
item.description: Firefighters were still trying to fully extinguish the blaze, a day after it engulfed an apartment complex. More than 270 people were still missing.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Smoke rises from a residential complex in Tai Po on Thursday.

item.title: Jimmy Fallon Gets Into the Spirit of ‘Drinksgiving’
item.description: “’Twas the night before Thanksgiving, and in your parents’ house, they put the Peloton in your old bedroom, so you’re sleeping on the couch,” Fallon mused.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: El calendario Putin 2026 ya está a la venta
item.description: Este año no hay fotos del líder ruso con el torso desnudo, pero hay citas y consejos: “Mi receta para la energía: duerme poco, trabaja mucho y no te quejes”.
item.dc:creator: Neil MacFarquhar

item.title: 5 nuevos parques de esculturas que hay que conocer
item.description: Ya sea en la campiña inglesa o en un bosque de Tailandia, el arte y la naturaleza van de la mano.
item.dc:creator: Gisela Williams
item.category: Srihatta-Samdani Art Centre and Sculpture Park (Sylhet, Bangladesh)
Goodwood Art Foundation (West Sussex, England, Museum)
Khao Yai Art Forest (Khao Yai, Thailand, Museum)

item.title: Last-Minute Vegetarian Thanksgiving Recipes
item.description: Last-minute holiday recipes for side dishes and desserts, and a few ideas for tomorrow.
item.dc:creator: Tanya Sichynsky

media:content.media:credit: Linda Xiao for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Spencer Richards.
media:content.media:description: Noor Murad’s maple sweet potatoes with crispy almonds and sage.

item.title: Trump Administration Pauses Immigration From Afghanistan After D.C. Shooting
item.description: The U.S. agency overseeing immigration made the announcement after an Afghan man shot two National Guard troops near the White House.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officers gathering after the shooting of two National Guardsmen in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday.

item.title: Heading to the Mideast, Pope Leo May Show ‘Who He Really Is’
item.description: The pontiff begins a trip to Turkey and Lebanon on Thursday — the first foreign voyage of his papacy, and his biggest test yet.
item.dc:creator: Motoko Rich

media:content.media:description: A billboard welcoming Pope Leo XIV in Beirut, Lebanon. The country has the largest community of Catholics in the Middle East.

item.title: Corrections: Nov. 27, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Thursday, Nov. 27, 2025.

item.title: Quote of the Day: In GPS Age, Aspiring Cabbies Study London, Lane by Lane
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, November 27, 2025.

item.title: What We Know About the National Guard Shooting in D.C. and the Suspect
item.description: Two National Guard members are in critical condition after a man shot them near the White House on the eve of Thanksgiving.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Two members of the National Guard were critically wounded in a shooting near the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Before the Shooting, Some Troops and Officials Worried About the Guard’s Safety
item.description: In an internal memo, Guard commanders warned that troops were in a “heightened threat environment.”
item.dc:creator: Campbell Robertson, Shawn Hubler and Chris Hippensteel
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Philip Cheung for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Members of National Guard securing a federal building in Los Angeles last June.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Nov. 27, 2025
item.description: Alexander Liebeskind goes back to his roots.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Kagan

media:content.media:description: What’s a four-letter word for puzzle pro?

item.title: What Is Operation Allies Welcome, the Program That Gave Some Afghans Entry to the U.S.?
item.description: The Biden administration set up the initiative after the Taliban retook power in Afghanistan in August 2021 for those who assisted U.S. troops.
item.dc:creator: Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:description: Brig. Gen. Dan Gabrielli greeting Afghans at Holloman Air Force Base in New Mexico as part of Operation Allies Welcome in 2021.

item.title: Hong Kong Arrests 3 Tied to Construction Company After Deadly Apartment Fire
item.description: The police said that building materials used by the company for the work at Wang Fuk Court may not have been up to fire safety standards. The police did not identify the company or who was arrested.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Stevenson

media:content.media:description: Hong Kong firefighters battling the blaze at Wang Fuk Court on Wednesday night.

item.title: Leaked Transcript of Witkoff Call Shows U.S. Deference to Russia
item.description: The White House envoy’s conversation suggests that President Trump is determined to make a deal to end the war in Ukraine, even if it is mostly on Russia’s terms.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski

media:content.media:description: President Trump defended his envoy Steve Witkoff’s leaked conversation as a “standard thing” that “a deal maker does.”

item.title: Campbell’s Says Executive Accused of Offensive Remarks Has Left the Company
item.description: The comments came to light after an audiotape was released, tied to a lawsuit filed by a former employee.
item.dc:creator: Emmett Lindner

media:content.media:description: Campbell’s said it learned about an audiotape reportedly featuring the voice of a company executive when a lawsuit was filed last week.

item.title: Trump Orders 500 More National Guard Troops to D.C. After Shooting
item.description: The president described the shooting as an “act of terror” and “a crime against humanity” and called the suspect, an Afghan national, an “animal.”
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A cordoned-off area near a shooting in Washington on Wednesday. President Trump ordered 500 more National Guard members to Washington after the shooting.

item.title: New York’s BQE Is Falling Apart. The City Can’t Agree on How to Fix It.
item.description: The Brooklyn-Queens Expressway has exceeded its life span. Clashing visions have hindered a solution.
item.dc:creator: Winnie Hu, Helmuth Rosales and Marco Hernandez

item.title: In Hiring, Are Skills the New Degrees?
item.description: The talent you’re looking for might be where you least expect them.

item.title: EE. UU. podrá usar el territorio de República Dominicana para combatir el crimen organizado
item.description: El mandatario dominicano, Luis Abinader, dijo que el Pentágono podría usar zonas restringidas de la Base Aérea de San Isidro y del Aeropuerto Internacional de Las Américas para reabastecerse de combustible y transportar equipos y personal técnico.
item.dc:creator: Maria Abi-Habib and Hogla Enecia Pérez

media:content.media:description: El secretario de Defensa, Pete Hegseth, en una rueda de prensa tras reunirse con el presidente de la República Dominicana, Luis Abinader, el miércoles en el Palacio Nacional de Santo Domingo.

item.title: Two National Guard Members Shot Near White House
item.description: Two members of the West Virginia National Guard were in critical condition after being shot near the White House on Wednesday. Officials said the gunman was in custody and appeared to have acted alone.
item.dc:creator: Chevaz Clarke and Jiawei Wang
item.category: US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secret Service officer securing the site of a shooting near the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: U.S. to Press Europe and Other Allies on Immigration, Document Says
item.description: American diplomats were told to raise U.S. concerns about “violent crimes associated with people of a migration background.”
item.dc:creator: Edward Wong and Hamed Aleaziz

item.title: Dominican Republic Allows U.S. to Use Territory to Fight International Organized Crime
item.description: The Dominican leader, Luis Abinader, said the Pentagon could use restricted areas within the San Isidro Air Base and Las Américas International Airport for refueling and transporting equipment and technical personnel.
item.dc:creator: Maria Abi-Habib and Hogla Enecia Pérez

media:content.media:description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth at a news conference after meeting with President Luis Abinader of the Dominican Republic on Wednesday at the National Palace in Santo Domingo.

item.title: Trump Says South Africa Is Not Invited to G20 Summit in U.S. in 2026
item.description: The president did not attend this year’s annual gathering in South Africa, which has been a frequent target of his attacks.
item.dc:creator: John Eligon

media:content.media:description: President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa addresses the opening session of the G20 leaders’ summit, in Johannesburg.

item.title: As Trade Talks Stall, Carney Moves to Shield Canada from Trump Tariffs
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced curbs on steel imports, a new tariff and help with steel and lumber freight costs in a bid to aid Canadian industries.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen

media:content.media:credit: Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada arriving on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Wednesday.

item.title: E.P.A. Delays Requirements to Cut Methane, a Potent Greenhouse Gas
item.description: Oil and gas firms were supposed to start reducing methane, a powerful driver of climate change. The agency is giving them more time and may cancel the requirement.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Friedman and Maxine Joselow

media:content.media:credit: Desiree Rios for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A gas flare at an oil facility in Midland, Texas.

item.title: Un complejo de apartamentos se incendió en Hong Kong. Esto es lo que sabemos
item.description: Los bomberos lucharon por contener las llamas en los edificios de gran altura. Al menos 36 personas murieron, y se teme que muchas más quedaran atrapadas en el interior de las torres.
item.dc:creator: Lynsey Chutel

media:content.media:description: El incendio se declaró en el distrito de Tai Po, al norte de Hong Kong.

item.title: North Carolina Can Use Republican-Friendly Congressional Map, Court Says
item.description: The district court ruling means that the party is one step closer to securing another seat in the U.S. House and retaining its majority, at the urging of President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Medina

media:content.media:credit: Cornell Watson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Voters in Durham, N.C., last year. A panel of federal judges in North Carolina allowed the state’s newly redrawn congressional map to go into effect for the 2026 midterm elections.

item.title: Narcos
item.description: Narcos

media:content.media:credit: Daniele Volpe for The New York Times

item.title: U.S. Army Secretary’s Unusual Role in Ukraine Peace Negotiations
item.description: Daniel Driscoll has met with Ukrainian and Russian officials during a whirlwind of trips as the Trump administration pushes its latest proposal.
item.dc:creator: Helene Cooper and Anton Troianovski
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: The U.S. Army secretary, Daniel Driscoll, standing, as an American delegation met with Ukrainian officials in Geneva on Sunday. Mr. Driscoll, a 39-year-old former Army lieutenant colonel, appears to be on the rise in the Trump administration.

item.title: Fed Up With the Taliban, Pakistan Expels Masses of Afghans
item.description: Labeling Afghans a national security threat, Pakistan has forced out more than 700,000 this year, depriving them of a haven from Afghanistan’s turmoil.

media:content.media:credit: Asim Hafeez for The New York Times

item.title: Top U.S. Negotiator Warned Europeans That Russia Is Stockpiling Missiles
item.description: Daniel P. Driscoll, the U.S. Army secretary, used the growing threat from Moscow as a way to sell a quick peace deal unfavorable to Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Andrew E. Kramer

media:content.media:description: Piles of spent Russian missiles at a “graveyard” for war ordnance in the Kharkiv region of Ukraine in July.

item.title: Dubrovnik, Known for Its Beauty, Faces a Mound of New Trash
item.description: Officials in Dubrovnik, Croatia, say the strong currents of the Adriatic Sea washed ashore a vast amount of garbage, mostly from Albania, during a recent storm.
item.dc:creator: Adeel Hassan

media:content.media:description: Banje Beach is the most popular beach on Croatia’s shore, but there were no sunbathers on Wednesday.

item.title: China y Japón están enfrentados. Y en medio está Donald Trump
item.description: Tras meses de disputas con Estados Unidos por sus aranceles, China y Japón ahora quieren el apoyo de este país para sus respectivas posturas sobre Taiwán.
item.dc:creator: Keith Bradsher and River Akira Davis
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump y Xi Jinping reunidos en Busan, Corea del Sur, en octubre. La llamada telefónica mantenida el lunes entre ambos dirigentes se produjo en un momento en que han aumentado las tensiones entre China y Japón.

item.title: National Guard Shooting Rattles D.C. Residents and Tourists on Thanksgiving Eve
item.description: On the eve of Thanksgiving, bystanders said the sound of gunfire was followed by anxiety over who did the shooting.
item.dc:creator: Jacey Fortin, Anton Troianovski, Michael C. Bender and Elizabeth Williamson
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secret Service officer securing the site of a shooting near the White House on Wednesday.

item.title: Who is Ahead in the Tennessee Seventh District Race? Latest 2025 Special Election Polls
item.description: Track the latest polls about Democrat Aftyn Behn and Republican Matt Van Epps in the special election in Tennessee's Seventh Congressional District.

item.title: Winter Storm Brings Heavy Snow to Upper Midwest
item.description: Blizzards blanketed the parts of northern Wisconsin and Michigan’s Upper Peninsula with heavy snow. Some areas may receive up to 30 inches of snow, according to the Weather Service.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:description: Storms may create challenges for some travelers across the country.

item.title: Paul Ekman, Who Linked Facial Expressions to Universal Emotions, Dies at 91
item.description: Often called the world’s most famous face reader, he inspired the TV show ‘Lie to Me.’ But some questioned his assumption that human expressions were ‘pan-cultural.’
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

item.title: Un disfraz de salmón se robó el show de Miss Universo
item.description: A la diseñadora del extravagante atuendo de Miss Noruega no le sorprendió la atención. “El plan original era hacer ruido”, dijo.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy

media:content.media:description: Leonora Lysglimt-Rødland, quien representó a Noruega en el concurso Miss Universo este mes, vestida de salmón durante el concurso nacional de disfraces del evento.

item.title: David Lerner, a Mr. Fix-it of Apple Computers, Dies at 72
item.description: He and a partner founded Tekserve, a Manhattan emergency room for frozen hard drives, keyboards, screens and their confounded owners.
item.dc:creator: Sam Roberts

media:content.media:description: David Lerner, in suspenders, with Dick Demenus at Tekserve in 2002. The service outlet was featured on “Sex and the City” and was the setting of Tamara Shopsin’s 2021 novel “LaserWriter II.”

item.title: Watch Live: Officials Give Update After Shooting Near White House
item.description: Officials give an update on the shooting near the White House.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Multiple law enforcement agencies responded to the site of a shooting near the White House in Washington on Wednesday.

item.title: F.D.A. Withdraws Rule to Require Testing Cosmetics Made With Talc for Asbestos
item.description: The agency said it planned to craft a more comprehensive rule, but the move alarmed public health advocates, who have long worked to eliminate asbestos in consumer products.
item.dc:creator: Roni Caryn Rabin

media:content.media:credit: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Many makeup products continue to be made with talc, which is added because it absorbs moisture and creates a silky feel.

item.title: U.K. Budget Plan Calms Markets and Labour Faithful. Will It Appeal to Voters?
item.description: The plan presented by the chancellor of the Exchequer, Rachel Reeves, called for spending increases and higher taxes on the wealthy and the middle class.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler

media:content.media:description: Rachel Reeves, Britain’s chancellor of the Exchequer, carries a red box symbolizing the presentation of a new government budget on Wednesday in London.

item.title: An Asia-Pacific Showdown
item.description: China and Japan are in a diplomatic feud over Taiwan, with President Trump in the middle.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi of Japan and China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

item.title: Why Is the National Guard in Washington, D.C.?
item.description: The troops are deployed in the capital as part of the president’s crackdown on crime.
item.dc:creator: Helene Cooper
item.category: US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)

media:content.media:credit: Alex Kent for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: National Guard members have patrolled metro stations and tourist areas in Washington since President Trump deployed them in August.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘No Hugging … and Definitely Nothing Lewd’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: Workers Inflate Balloons Ahead of Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
item.description: Teams of workers in New York City began inflating balloons on Wednesday for the 99th Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Leventhal

media:content.media:description: The Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade makes its way down Central Park West in 2023.

item.title: Differences Over Health Care and Ukraine Roil a Chaotic G.O.P. Congress
item.description: Republican lawmakers and the White House have unloaded on one another as post-shutdown tension over policy and performance spreads across Capitol Hill.
item.dc:creator: Carl Hulse
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

media:content.media:description: Representative Don Bacon, Republican of Nebraska, at the Capitol this month. He has announced he plans to retire at the end of his term in early 2027.

item.title: Live Updates: National Guard Members Shot Near White House Are in Critical Condition
item.description: Officials called the shooting a targeted attack by a man from Afghanistan who entered the U.S. in 2021. President Trump vowed to redouble the government’s efforts to deport migrants.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
